After taking a break from TF2 (which I have done many a time before) and returning, it is nice to see that the bot issue has been a bit tamed. It's still an issue, but it's much less frequent. It's nice to see one of my favorite games of all time, which was rampant with bots a couple months to a point where Valve run servers were basically unplayable, to a now much more playable state. This game was hugely important for my interest in PC gaming.

My name is George Corbin friends call me "Big George" it's a silly inside joke in my group of friends down at Bobby's bar at the corner of Abilene and Fort Worth Avenue. SELLING 1972 Cadillac Fleetwood 472ci V8 3-speed automatic. AC no longer works never got around to fixing it but the WINDOWS Do roll down it's a great feature. ORIginal manual and 1966 Colt Python double action in the glove box, still loaded with 4 .357 rounds. Rear seats badly stained from the accident I had back in '83 when I had to use said revolver. Left front headlamp has been replaced recently it works like a beaut. Meet me in GARLAND, TEXAS I'll be standing underneath the GRAND oak tree with the vehicle ready to sell my name is George just yell my name out and I'll yell back ok thanks bye have a blessed day 1972 Cadillac Fleetwo

I used to have a *quite* popular review on Team Fortress 2 that I wrote back in 2012, back when the game was fun, playable and enjoyable, back when we used to have a blast playing as a community not being troubled with any issues regarding the game.
It's not like that anymore.
Ever since 2018 this game has been unplayable officially. Cheaters and Bots plague every single Casual game, no matter when or where, you will just get kicked almost immediately after joining Casual by said bots.
Valve has refused to acknowledge this issue for four years now, pushing 8+ lootbox cases during that time and completely neglecting the issue. It actually blows my mind that people still rally behind Valve and support the company, considering they've done absolutely nothing to fix major flaws in their flagship titles like Team Fortress 2 and Counter-Strike Global Offensive.

Just sad and depressing.
This game deserves a more attention from Valve, then their other two cursed online games. We need a new quality content, not only patches and cases...

After 3 years of not playing, this game still feels like part of yourself. Demoknights, trolldiers, friendly pootis heavies, where else could you find something like them besides TF2? So many memories, friends and everyone I cared for were met on these battle fields.

Should you try it? Definitely. Play on community servers if you're affraid of hack bots, or at least tf2 classic mod which feels like Team Fortress 2 from 2008.

Out of all the FPS games I've played, I cannot recall any of them having as much heart as Team Fortress 2. Team Fortress 2 does an impeccable job at having heart by its unique and charming characters, artstyle, community (despite it's blemishes) and great gameplay. All of the characters in this game are memorable and impactful on the battlefield. They're all enjoyable to watch, enjoyable to play as and enjoyable to read about. TF2's artstyle makes it really distinct, and very pleasing to the eyes. How the community of this game manages to survive with Overwatch, without updates AND a bot crisis is beyond me, but if that doesn't prove how much passion is behind the TF2 community, then I have no clue what does. The gameplay respects your intelligence and lets players learn each of the nuances of combat and the classes of the game e.g rocketjumping, trimping, etc. If none of that convinces you than it's a good thing the game is free, so there's no harm in trying it out even if it's really old.
